primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from the seduction of 'commodity' (materialism/secular success) to the 'communion' of God's presence through a transformative 'until' moment.

subject.identificatie: The Psalmist / The Hearer / The Prodigal Son
tekstueel_bewijs: I have kept my heart clean
I decided to give up my Torah piety
I have made the Lord God my refuge
God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever
the very best thing is to be near God
The premise of the Psalm in v. 1 is the premise of Old Testament faith
He was an Israelite under Torah discipline
God is deeply... committed to God’s people
the alternative is the one who is endlessly our true home
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is invited to identify with the Subject (the one making the decision).

helper.identificatie: The Sanctuary / The 'Until' moment / The Father's Love
tekstueel_bewijs: until I went into the sanctuary of God
a gift to be received in an upstream decision
helper.rol_van_god: God is primarily the Object (the goal) and the Helper (the one holding the hand), but the human is the Subject of the 'going' and 'deciding'.

tekstueel_bewijs: the mad pursuit of commodity by his consuming neighbors
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is framed as a seductive socio-economic system and an internal 'double-mindedness' rather than a cosmic ontological power like Sin or Death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical/political resistance to globalization and empire.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The personal 'until' (communion) enables the church to become a 'carrier' of this alternative against the world's 'death script'.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Covenant Premise → Communion → The People of God
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Sanctuary → The Doubting Believer ← Market Ideology

you guide me with your counsel

I have made the Lord God my refuge
we should be weaned from the seductions

voorbeelden: restraints that he had learned to take as normative
nothing on earth that I desire other than you

permits him to slough off his false self

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' narrative. It focuses on the shift of the Subject's desire (Vouloir) from commodity to God. It assumes the hearer has the power to decide once they 'perceive' (Savoir) the truth.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved through a 're-orientation' of the mind and a 'decision' to return to the father/sanctuary.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 (Commodity/Empire) is treated as a 'fantasy' or 'phantom' rather than a binding power, making the exit seem primarily a matter of better perception.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While it uses the language of 'gift' and 'grace,' the actantial engine is anthropocentric. The human is the Subject who 'decides,' 'wakes up,' and 'goes to the sanctuary.' God is the 'Portion' to be chosen rather than the Actor who rescues.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: a gift to be received in an upstream decision that contradicts the easier decisions of our culture.
I have made the Lord God my refuge.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: you hold my right hand. You guide me with your counsel.
his father saw him and was filled with compassion; he ran and put his arms around him.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Psalmist and the Prodigal are presented as models for the hearer's own psychological and spiritual 'turn'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on the Father who runs (Subject) to the son who is still 'far off' (Receiver), emphasizing that the 'coming to himself' was a result of the Father's preceding providence.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Empowerment to make a 'better choice' against culture; potential for new legalism (the 'upstream decision').
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism: God provides the sanctuary/home, but man must perform the 'until' to reach it.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Highly coherent as a narrative of 're-orientation', though it struggles to reconcile 'gift' with 'upstream decision'.
spanning_punten: The 'gift' is described as something that requires a difficult 'upstream decision' (Paradox of Effort).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: until seeing the face of the crucified... we have looked into the face of Jesus and have seen the ultimate offer.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'Until' functions as a cognitive/mystical endowment of Savoir-faire (knowing) rather than a supernatural Pouvoir-faire (power).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'stupidity' (brute beast) or being 'duped' by image-makers. It is a lack of wisdom rather than a state of death.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: God (as the 'Portion' that remains when flesh fails).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully diagnoses the 'Opponent' (Commodity/Empire) but places the 'Subject' burden on the hearer to 'wake up' and 'decide'.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The 'Until' is treated as a human movement toward the sanctuary.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the Subject of the 'Until'. God disrupts the spell of the market.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Until I went into the sanctuary,' use 'Until God broke into my blindness in the sanctuary.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the one who must 'wean' themselves.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the Father's running (Luke 15) as the primary action that creates the 'after'.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the 'Portion' (God) actually holds the hand of the one who is slipping, even before they 'wake up'.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Describe the 'Death Script' as a power we cannot escape by 'deciding' alone.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To make Grace (God as Subject) necessary rather than just a better option.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The hierarchy is mostly correct, but the transition is too anthropocentric.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A rhetorically brilliant and prophetic sermon that masterfully identifies the cultural 'Opponent'. To move from 'Mixed' to 'Grace-oriented', the 'Until' must be preached as God's intervention rather than man's realization.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would praise the 'until/nevertheless' structure; Greimas reveals the human is doing the heavy lifting in that transition.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the 'portion'; Greimas shows that 'portion' is being treated as a commodity to be chosen by a sovereign consumer-subject.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Prodigal' midrash focuses on the son's 'coming to himself' (Subject) rather than the Father's 'running' (Subject), exposing a subtle semiotic moralism.

volledige_subject_lijst: He (Psalmist) noticed those who held Torah loosely
I (Preacher) judge that the church is at the brink
The Father (Subject) saw him... ran... put arms around him
appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Grace' as a noun/object but 'Decision' as the primary active verb for the transition.
